intro: Patrinia dielsii, commonly known as Chinese yarrow, is a perennial herb native to China. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Patrinia dielsii is valued in traditional Chinese medicine for its purported health benefits.
